question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closure at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

If no such announcement is made, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 and not die before Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a NO resolution as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution. (b) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024 and survive until Saturday, July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Joe Biden stays as the US President until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time), meaning he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President prior to that date. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment, which makes his Vice President the Acting President, will not result in a NO resolution, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution. (b) There is no formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If both criteria are met, the resolution will be YES. If either or both criteria are not met, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. (b) Joe Biden ceases to be the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the YES resolution for part (b). Otherwise, the question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden is no longer in the role of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. (b) Joe Biden is no longer the President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (ET) due to resignation, death, or any other circumstances. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the YES resolution for part (b). In all other cases, the question will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the United States secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the 2024 Olympics in Paris?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed with a Yes if the Olympic Team of the United States achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

question.title: Will the USA both top the Olympic Medal Table and win as many or more Silver than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following occur:
(a) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team wins as many or more Silver medals than Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

para_P.title: Will the USA be the leading nation in the Olympic Medal Table and secure at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following conditions are satisfied:
(a) The United States Olympic Team emerges as the (sole) top-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them by:
1. Total number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total number of Bronze Medals

(b) The United States Olympic Team achieves at least as many Silver medals as Gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

The question will be deemed unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions are met:
(a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table which orders countries by the number of Gold medals, then Silver medals, then Bronze medals. This question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves NO if neither condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (a) the USA secures a greater number of Gold medals than Silver or (b) the USA leads the Olympic Medal Rankings?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a YES answer if at least one of the two following scenarios occurs:
(a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals compared to Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.
(b) The United States Olympic Team stands as the sole highest-ranked team in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which are determined by the number of Gold medals first, followed by Silver and then Bronze medals. The question will be considered ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not happen prior to 2027. A NO answer will be given if neither of the scenarios is fulfilled.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump will not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There must be no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

The question will resolve as **No** if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Donald Trump will not face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the election day in 2024.

2. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There should be no official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports affirming such a disqualification or removal. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has not been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified provisions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or removed from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or removed from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve positively.

The inquiry will resolve with **No** if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". (b) Donald Trump will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following criteria is satisfied:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be validated by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". This inquiry may take into account new candidates that may be introduced in the future. It is solely determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This part of the question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The lack of removal or block is confirmed through the absence of official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports indicating such a removal. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Donald Trump will not face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment of the inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This segment of the inquiry will conclude as "Yes" if, *as of* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The confirmation of no disqualification or barring is established through the lack of official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports indicating such disqualification. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Donald Trump remains on any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned provisions as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump be removed from any primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively. (b) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, the question resolves as "Yes".

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified from any primary election ballot due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or that Ted Cruz will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these stipulations are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively. (b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, the question will resolve as "Yes".

question.body:

(b) The INC does not have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister.

This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional options may be introduced later.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they contend suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as per a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 members from the House or Senators who are affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (2) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(1) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(2) Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will there be two events: (1) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, and (2) fewer than 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(1) Will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(2) Will fewer than 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter opposing the early nomination of Biden?
Context from Politico:

Many House Democrats are coordinating a response against their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than planned, arguing that it suppresses the ongoing critical discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that numerous members are quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“This is a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart strategy to eliminate debate and force unity, but that approach isn’t effective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of fewer than 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify and Latvia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Belgium advance while Latvia does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is then officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will either Latvia or Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Latvia nor Belgium qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Latvia or Belgium set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Latvia nor Belgium qualifies, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it indicates 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate occurs before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) a subsequent presidential debate for the Democratic party is held prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) less than 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will resolve to NO if there is not.

(b) If, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports that fewer than 10 Democratic Senators are calling for Biden to step down, this will resolve to YES. If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside before July 20, or (b) another debate occurs for the Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will urge Biden to resign before July 20? The source for resolution is: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators by midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will be deemed a yes. If not, it will be a no.

(b) Will another debate for Democratic presidential candidates take place? This will be confirmed as YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. If no debate takes place, it will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland set to advance to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will resolve with a **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Luxembourg qualifies for the Grand Final and (b) Ireland fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that in Eurovision 2024, both (a) Luxembourg makes it to the Grand Final and (b) Ireland does not make it to the Grand Final?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the following two criteria are satisfied: (1) Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In all other scenarios, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024; (b) Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualifies, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that might emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it is irrelevant who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee and Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (1) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (2) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution of this question is not affected by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates may be considered in the future, but both conditions must be simultaneously satisfied for a **Yes** resolution.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate while Donald Trump will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if BOTH of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, AND (2) Donald Trump is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome of this inquiry is not influenced by who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. New candidates may be introduced later, but both criteria must be met at the same time for a **Yes** outcome.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Donald Trump or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will the likelihood of Kamala winning rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman (b) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(b) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 will be a woman (b) Kamala Harris's chances of winning will not improve over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It will be marked as “no” if they select a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the probability of Harris winning according to Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will Nate Silver's model indicate an increase in Kamala's chances of winning or will the Democratic nominee for 2024 be a female?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Nate Silver's model show an enhancement in Kamala's chances of victory in the upcoming week? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will a woman be the Democratic nominee for President in 2024? It will resolve “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024. It will resolve “no” if the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

The term "accessible to the general public" indicates that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (which may require a payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), the answer will still be **YES**, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web platform (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. The answer will still be **YES** even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems utilizing Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market embedded in the link has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market. (Market link: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(b) The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT (chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Not generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the referenced market will have no fewer than 377 traders by the close of July 15, 2023, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will not be broadly accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market linked has at least 377 traders prior to the market's closing time (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. Apologies to my very dedicated followers; I've found myself involved in some market antics, which is why I'm creating this market. (Market link: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(b) The question will resolve as YES if ChatGPT (chat.openai.com) is not widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Not widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they cannot access it without using a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is inaccessible in specific EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for instance) minors, this will resolve affirmatively, provided that over 50% of the populace cannot utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains largely the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, or will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), it will still resolve positively if >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) The linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO if fewer than 377 traders are recorded by this deadline.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI's ChatGPT expected to be widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, or will the associated market have a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **YES** if at least one of the following situations occurs: 

(a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without requiring a VPN (potentially involving a payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations, or not accessible to certain demographics (such as minors), it will still be deemed positive if over 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general online interface for engaging with GPT models, and will be positively resolved if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the branding or website alters.

(b) The associated market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has a count of at least 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be considered NO if fewer than 377 traders are noted by this deadline.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a Woman (b) Joe Biden will not die before Saturday?
question.body:
This question resolves to “yes” if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
(b) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

It resolves to “no” if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 (b) Joe Biden will remain alive until Saturday?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a “yes” if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: 

(a) A female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates as the presidential nominee for the 2024 elections.
(b) There is no public confirmation of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th.

It will result in a “no” if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. 

If neither condition is met, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden passes away before Saturday or that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Candidate is a Woman?
para_P.body:
This inquiry concludes with a YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) A female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. 

If neither scenario takes place, it will result in a NO.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia gain dominance over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) displays the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E categorized under any of the subsequent classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will be deemed **No** if the site is not classified in any of the categories denoting Russian control, which encompasses but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Last 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or an absence of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia does not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control. It resolves as No if the location is in any categories indicating Russian control, including assessed Russian advance, gains, or control, or claimed Russian territory in Ukraine.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Russia does not possess control over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(b) Will Russia lack control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This will be considered Yes if, when checked by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any categories that show Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control. It will be considered No if the location falls under any categories indicating Russian control, including assessed Russian advances, gains, or control, or claimed Russian territory in Ukraine.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Russia is assessed to have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, according to the ISW map criteria, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle.

Details for (a): This part will resolve as Yes if, according to the ISW map accessed on June 1, 2024, the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E are under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine" or similar categories. It will resolve as No if the location is not under categories indicating Russian control.

Details for (b): This part will resolve as Yes if Joe Biden makes an unambiguous and conclusive statement before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. If no such statement is made by then, it will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Will Russia gain control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as Yes if either of the following happens: (a) On June 1, 2024, it is determined that Russia has control over Chasiv Yar based on the ISW map criteria, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

Details for (a): This segment will be resolved as Yes if, per the ISW map reviewed on June 1, 2024, the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under classifications signifying Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine" or similar classifications. It will be resolved as No if the location does not fall under categories indicating Russian control.

Details for (b): This segment will be resolved as Yes if Joe Biden makes a clear and definitive announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination. If such a statement is not made by that date, it will be resolved as No.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Taylor Swift will make a guest appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if she is featured in the film in any capacity, including if only her voice is utilized for a character. It will still be marked YES even if she does not receive credit on IMDB, as long as it is verified by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

question.title: Will "Deadpool x Wolverine" have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie AND will Taylor Swift not cameo in the movie?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. (2) Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie "Deadpool x Wolverine" in any role, including voice roles. It will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB and there are no independent sources confirming her appearance.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend of "Deadpool x Wolverine" set a new record for R-rated films AND will Taylor Swift not make an appearance in the film?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) "Deadpool x Wolverine" earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend as reported, and the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) recognizes it as the highest-grossing opening for an R-rated film. (2) Taylor Swift does not feature in the movie "Deadpool x Wolverine" in any capacity, including voice roles. It will still be considered YES if she is uncredited on IMDB and there are no independent confirmations of her involvement.

question.title: Will either Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, or will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Taylor Swift appears in the "Deadpool and Wolverine" movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent publication) as the record for the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The BoxOfficeMojo numbers are considered unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press, and the target number is over $284.5 million internationally for the weekend.

para_P.title: Will Taylor Swift make an appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine, or will the film achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated feature?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Taylor Swift is featured in the "Deadpool and Wolverine" film in any capacity, even if it is merely her voice for a character. This will be considered YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by independent sources.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar outlet) as setting the record for the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. The figures from BoxOfficeMojo are regarded as unofficial until validated by the Hollywood press, with the target being over $284.5 million internationally for the weekend.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Israel executing a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved presidential candidates, and (b) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, and (b) there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it the case that both of the following will happen: (a) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed as an approved candidate by Iran's Guardian Council for the presidential election, and (b) Israel refrains from executing a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's approved list of candidates for the upcoming presidential election in Iran, and (b) there are no credible reports suggesting that an Israeli attack within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people from the time this question is posed until May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before May 1, 2024: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (b) Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as an approved presidential candidate?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these events will take place prior to May 1, 2024: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is recognized by Iran's Guardian Council as an eligible candidate for the presidency?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's roster of approved candidates for the forthcoming presidential election in Iran.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Biden not drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race past July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen as the Republican candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a resolution of **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being introduced in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) If Biden does not withdraw and is able to continue his campaign beyond July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If he withdraws, this market will conclude with a no.

para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
