Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election, and (b) Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria:

1. The first component will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

2. The second component will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this component will resolve as No.

This combined question will resolve as Yes if both components resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024, while Joe Biden refrains from announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Republican Party maintains control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly held by Bill Johnson) in the special election of 2024, and (b) Joe Biden does not make an announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Criteria for resolution:

1. The first part will be considered Yes if reliable sources confirm that a representative of the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In case of conflicting popular sources, an official statement from Ohio State will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

2. The second part will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not issue a clear, public, official statement declaring that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part will be considered No.

This combined inquiry will be deemed Yes if both parts are resolved as Yes.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, with a definitive, public, official announcement that is unambiguous and conclusive, or (b) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, as reported by credible sources, or if there is disagreement, by an Ohio State source or statement? If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question regarding Ohio's 6th district is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, declaring that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, or will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will issue a clear, public, and definitive statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle, or (b) the Republican Party will successfully hold onto Ohio's 6th congressional district during the 2024 special election, as confirmed by reliable sources, or if there is any dispute, by a statement or source from Ohio? If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, the inquiry about Ohio's 6th district becomes void.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** outcome. It is important to note that this question is not limited to the candidates listed currently; additional candidates may be included later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Rishi Sunak does not get elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Vivek Ramaswamy does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Rishi Sunak does not secure a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is nominated, this question will also resolve as **Yes**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later. The determination for this question is not based on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in this election, this part of the question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution for the second part should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following situations occurs:

1. The Republican National Convention designates Vivek Ramaswamy as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on election day in 2024.

2. Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during this election, this portion of the question will resolve as **No**.

The resolution for the second part should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in the presidency at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary handover of authority as outlined in the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot for federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Biden cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition is not met.

2. Joe Biden ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET) by resigning, dying, or otherwise leaving office. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not meet this condition, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

The question resolves as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified from a primary election ballot for federal office due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Joe Biden no longer hold the presidency before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after the specified date. It specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the condition is not fulfilled.

2. Joe Biden must no longer be the President of the United States before the conclusion of July 2024 (ET) by means of resignation, death, or other departure from office. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not satisfy this requirement, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution.

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through July 2024 or Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then (temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President); (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after July 15, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the presidency until July 2024, or will Trump be disqualified from a primary ballot due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden stays in office as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024, which means he does not resign, pass away, or otherwise stop being President prior to that time (a temporary power transfer under the 25th Amendment does not count as stopping being President); (b) Donald Trump is formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. This inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later changes after July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties that would affect the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, 2024, this condition resolves NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will resolve as YES if there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the specified date.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) At least 5 specific Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024, AND (2) The EU does not declare new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 5 identified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senators must collaborate to persuade Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or any form of joint action. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication. Merely having five individuals express their opinions separately to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports involving any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step down will not meet the requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the deadline. Ambiguous situations will be resolved in favor of NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, 2024, this aspect will resolve as NO.

(2) The European Union (EU) must refrain from announcing any new tariffs or taxes on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This condition will be considered YES if there are no credible reports of the EU declaring new tariffs or taxes that would impact the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before the stated date.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) The EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EV imports, or (2) A group of 5 named Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
(1) The EU announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report that the EU has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, speaking with Biden in person, or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and the names must be made public. In ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen prior to their specified deadlines: (1) The EU will declare new tariffs on electric vehicle imports from China, or (2) A coalition of 5 identified Democratic lawmakers will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race?
para_P.body:
(1) The EU makes an announcement regarding new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This will be marked as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that the EU has declared that new tariffs or duties will be enforced on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) A coalition consisting of at least 5 identified Democratic Party members of the US House of Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter, engaging in direct conversation with Biden, or another method of collective action. All five individuals must be included in the same group communication, and their names must be publicly disclosed. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this will resolve NO.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be marked as **No** if any other team wins or if the Knicks are not in the running.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win and the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following are true according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. 

It resolves **No** if either the Miami Heat is not crowned champion or the New York Knicks are crowned champion.

para_P.title: Will the Miami Heat be the champions while the New York Knicks fail to win the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The New York Knicks are not declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. 

It will be resolved as **No** if either the Miami Heat is not declared champion or the New York Knicks are declared champion.

question.title: Will either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will result in a **No** if another team wins the championship or if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are out of the running.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently known; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, previously held by Bill Johnson. In case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

2. Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is satisfied. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Will the GOP keep Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming special election of 2024, and will Liz Cheney not be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Reliable sources indicate that a representative of the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district, which was formerly held by Bill Johnson. In the event of conflicting reports from major sources, an Ohio State source or statement will take precedence. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this aspect of the question becomes void.

2. Liz Cheney is not nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is met if any other contender is chosen. The decision will be based exclusively on the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be confirmed by credible sources, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of these events to take place: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is declared the nominee on election day.

(b) A candidate affiliated with the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This outcome will be verified by reliable sources, and in the case of conflicting reports among popular sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this portion of the question is void.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify and Greece fail to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Lithuania does not qualify or Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Lithuania to advance while Greece does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both conditions are satisfied: (a) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Greece does not make it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The answer will be **No** if either Lithuania fails to qualify or Greece qualifies.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece or Lithuania make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania advances, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President AND will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 3 points, as reported on the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be either 2 points or fewer, or exceed 3 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either 2 points or fewer, or more than 3 points, as shown in the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

If both criteria are not fulfilled, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before this date that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

1. Donald Trump’s advantage over Joe Biden is recorded as greater than 2 and not exceeding 3 in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

2. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on that same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are assessed to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The resolution may be delayed until the July 20 data is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will reference the winning probabilities of each candidate as a figure out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if BOTH of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself, and (b) Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. 

The market resolves NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the resolution source is Kamala Harris' announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate and will FiveThirtyEight indicate Trump as the frontrunner this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will resolve to YES if BOTH of the following conditions are met: (a) Kamala Harris publicly announces her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, with confirmation from Kamala herself, and (b) according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden. 

The market will resolve to NO if either: (a) Kamala Harris selects someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate, or (b) Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

The resolution source for Kamala Harris' vice-presidential selection is her official announcement. For the FiveThirtyEight projection, the resolution source is the FiveThirtyEight forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically referencing the data shown by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP?
question.body:
(a) 538 Project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024: This will occur if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19. Changes in methodology will not affect resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP: This will occur if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) 538 forecasts Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, or (b) Kamala Harris selects Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) 538 forecasting Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024: This will happen if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for that date. Methodology changes will not influence the resolution. If no data points for July 19 are available by July 22, the resolution will rely on the closest previous data to July 19.

(b) Kamala Harris selecting Kelly or Shapiro as her vice-presidential candidate: This will occur if Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th. The resolution will await confirmation of the pick directly from Kamala Harris.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024 and Kamala Harris not become President or Acting President before July 26, 2024?
question.body: This resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution for this part. (b) Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this is official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also being used.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024, and will Kamala Harris not take on the role of President or Acting President prior to July 26, 2024?
para_P.body: This will be deemed a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Joe Biden stays as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET), which means he does not step down, pass away, or otherwise stop being President before that date. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a NO outcome for this condition. (b) Kamala Harris is not officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024, or will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) Joe Biden remains the US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution for Biden remaining President.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Kamala Harris will assume the presidency by July 26, 2024, or will Joe Biden continue as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following happens: (a) Kamala Harris, the Vice President, is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, according to official US government announcements or a consensus from reliable news sources. (b) Joe Biden remains in office as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered "No" if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. It's important to note that a temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment, which makes the Vice President the Acting President, does not result in a YES answer regarding Biden's continued presidency.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the record time of 9.63 seconds for the men's 100m sprint be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 with a time shorter than 9.63 seconds, based on results from the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals (b) The men's 100m dash winning time does not break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This market will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable, and (b) No athlete runs the Men's 100m race in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If either condition is not met, the market will resolve to "No". In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes" if the Men's 100m dash condition is also satisfied at that time.

para_P.title: Will the Paris 2024 Olympics see both of these events: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes achieving at least 15 gold medals (b) The winning time of the men's 100m dash remaining above the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This market will be determined as "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals, as confirmed by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources in case IOC reporting is not available, and (b) No participant completes the Men's 100m race in under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the International Olympic Committee or trustworthy sources. If either criterion is not fulfilled, the market will be marked as "No". If it is established that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes" if the Men's 100m dash condition is also met at that moment.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 15 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either (a) any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the gold medals will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes". If neither of these events occur, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if either (a) any competitor completes the Men's 100M race at the Paris 2024 Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the same nation winning more than one women's team sport resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as Yes.

(b) The question about a swimmer not winning the most gold medals resolves as Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

If not, then that same NOC must have won at least two of these competitions, leading to a Yes response.

(b) The question concerning whether a swimmer does not claim the most gold medals is answered affirmatively if the competitor with the greatest number of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics does not participate in swimming.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if either of the subsequent events takes place: (a) The competitor who accumulates the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The answer will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) This resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is less than or equal to that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events happen: (a) A minimum of five named Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th, 2024 (b) Nvidia's market value is at most equal to Apple's on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) According to reports from Politico, two members from safe seats have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim. Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one draft is said to request Biden to end his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the matter. This will be marked as YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively ask Joe Biden to think about halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could take the form of a signed letter, similar to the reports mentioned earlier, or it could occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request him to withdraw. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. Merely five individuals separately expressing their belief to reporters that Biden should exit is insufficient for a YES outcome. Any reports of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden urging him to step aside will not count unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, the resolution will lean towards NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, the outcome will be NO.

(b) This will be marked YES if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's. This will be determined by comparing their market caps on Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) France places in the Top 5 and (b) Sha'Carri Richardson fails to win a gold medal?

2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official declarations from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

If Greens–EFA is tied for the most seats, condition (a) is still satisfied. If GUE/NGL is tied for the most seats, condition (b) is not satisfied.

If the Greens–EFA is tied for the highest number of seats, criterion (a) is still considered met. If GUE/NGL is tied for the highest number of seats, criterion (b) is not considered met.

This question will be resolved based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unspecified Democrat, will he secure at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted on Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a non-specific Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is determined by the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain active until their designated closing time regardless of circumstances.
