question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro and Biden not drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (2) Joe Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until after July 20 midnight Eastern Time. 

The question resolves to NO if either Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate or if Joe Biden drops out before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. 

For Kamala Harris' VP pick, the decision must be confirmed by Kamala herself before August 7th. For Joe Biden, he must remain in the race past July 20th midnight Eastern Time. 

Comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate, and will Biden remain in the race until after July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Kamala Harris declares her choice for vice-presidential candidate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (2) Joe Biden does not withdraw and is able to stay in the race until after July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. 

This inquiry will be deemed negative if either Kamala Harris names someone else as her running mate or if Joe Biden withdraws before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. 

For Kamala Harris' vice-presidential selection, the decision must be made public by her before August 7th. For Joe Biden, he must persist in the race beyond July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. 

Feel free to comment if you have any inquiries or updates 💙

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, or (b) Kamala Harris picks Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP by August 7?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve to YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

(b) This part of the question will resolve to YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. It will resolve to NO if she announces anyone else as her running mate. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, or (b) Kamala Harris selects Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her vice presidential candidate by August 7?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment of the inquiry will yield a YES if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to pursue the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If not, it will result in a NO.

(b) This segment will yield a YES if Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7. It will result in a NO if she selects anyone else as her running mate. The outcome will depend on the confirmation of the pick by Kamala herself.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday and will there be no more Democratic party presidential debates?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, and (2) there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves "No" if either or both conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the presidency by Friday without any further debates among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, according to official sources from the US government or a consensus of reliable news reports, and (2) there are no debates held among potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed "No" if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention or (b) Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This resolves to YES if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it resolves to NO. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) a subsequent presidential debate for the Democratic party takes place before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, or (b) Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO if not.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, it will be marked as NO. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Australia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Australia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Australia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify and Australia fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Australia either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Latvia does not qualify or Australia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that Latvia will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 while Australia will not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Australia either does not compete in a Semi-final or is not confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia fails to qualify or if Australia qualifies, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Australia or Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Australia or Latvia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Australia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average exceed 3 but not surpass 4?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be less than or equal to 3 points or greater than 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value is determined by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of these events to take place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is either 3 points or fewer or exceeds 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy needs to be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) On July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden must either be 3 points or less or exceed 4 points. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. This value is determined by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This will be resolved by checking the reported chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day. It is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following scenarios will take place: (a) Trump holds a lead over Biden that is more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or (b) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump holds a lead over Biden that is more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This will be determined by reviewing the reported chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead. For instance, a figure of 2.4 signifies that Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

(b) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be considered **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is nominated on election day. It is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Cyprus qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Ireland fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Ireland either does not participate in a Semi-final or is officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus does not qualify or Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Cyprus makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Ireland does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (1) Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024, and (2) Ireland either does not compete in a Semi-final or is officially stated by the EBU as not having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Cyprus fails to qualify or Ireland qualifies, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either Ireland or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Cyprus qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either Ireland or Cyprus to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either (a) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Cyprus advances, the inquiry will be regarded as **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania set to advance to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Azerbaijan qualifies for the Grand Final and (b) Lithuania fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. para_P.title: Will both of these events take place in Eurovision 2024: (a) Azerbaijan makes it to the Grand Final and (b) Lithuania does not make it to the Grand Final?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Azerbaijan takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should Azerbaijan fail to qualify or Lithuania qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will either Lithuania or Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occur: (a) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Lithuania nor Azerbaijan qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Lithuania or Azerbaijan make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Azerbaijan takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Lithuania nor Azerbaijan advances, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") that is over 4 and at most 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") observed from July 17 to July 28, 2024 (inclusive) exceeds 4 and is at most 5, as reported by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28 in the year 2024, will the most intense geomagnetic storm register a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 5 but does not surpass 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will yield a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 5 and at most 6, as reported by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period of July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 4 but does not go beyond 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will yield a Yes answer if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) surpasses 4 and is at most 6, based on the data provided by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party going to occur?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate takes place among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will there be no more Democratic party presidential debates?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This part will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO if there is such a debate.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden were to withdraw, would a credible news source report the event at least 6 hours beforehand? Additionally, will there be no further presidential debates for the Democratic party?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation no less than 6 hours prior to his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate. This part will be noted as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This will be marked as YES if there are no debates among potential Democratic candidates (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO if such a debate occurs.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Another presidential debate for the Democratic party occurs prior to the 2024 Convention (b) Joe Biden resigns and a trusted news source reports it 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate is held among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

(b) This will be marked as YES if a major and trustworthy news organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's resignation with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement via letter, speech, etc. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not resign before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be marked as **No** if any other teams are named champions following their elimination from the competition.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No if either the Clippers do not win or the Knicks win the championship.

para_P.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals while the New York Knicks do not claim the title?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The New York Knicks are not declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with No if either the Clippers fail to win or the Knicks secure the championship.

question.title: Will either the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship and both are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers to emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if neither team secures the championship and both are removed from the race.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault linked to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will Israel refrain from carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) If President Joe Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. (2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news source report on it at least 6 hours beforehand? Additionally, will Israel avoid launching a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Should President Joe Biden withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. (2) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports suggesting that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's territory, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, or (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) If President Joe Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024, or (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, a reputable news source reports the situation at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information emerges indicating that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of a minimum of five people.

(b) If President Joe Biden decides to withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the Rassemblement National for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if prior to June 30, 2024, an official electoral coalition or partnership is revealed between Les Républicains and Rassemblement National for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such partnership is declared, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, and (2) The Republicans Party of France will not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. (2) No electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election by June 30, 2024, according to credible sources. If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as No.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together, and will the Republicans Party of France refrain from forming a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Ted Cruz will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will be answered with Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. If such an announcement is not made by the deadline, this will be answered as No.

(b) Will Ted Cruz not be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This question will be answered with Yes if Ted Cruz is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the election day; it is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

1. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the election.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

If either of these conditions is met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: 

1. Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the candidate on election day.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would accept the nomination.

If either of these scenarios occurs, the question will be answered as **Yes**. If both scenarios do not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024 (b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI rises by 0.1% or less in July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as the Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by 0.1% or less in July 2024: Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase of 0.1% or less compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, or (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) The question about the US Core CPI resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) The question about Biden resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) The US Core CPI experiences a rise exceeding 0.1% month-over-month in July 2024, or (b) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the US Core CPI will be answered with YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to June 2024. The resolution will utilize data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, relying on the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) The question concerning Biden will be considered YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this matter. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted by Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll presents respondents with a choice including Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other includes a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the error margin. Do the Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader population?

This market will be marked YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result will be YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. In the Manifold polls that close on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump when facing Joe Biden does not exceed that when facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial (b) Trump receives less than 3% support from Manifold respondents against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. In the Manifold surveys that conclude on July 6, the share of votes for Donald Trump when up against Joe Biden does not surpass that against a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result will be YES if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is less than 0.03. If not, it will be NO. The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the closing time regardless.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Trump increases his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Biden and a generic Democrat, (b) Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. Public opinion surveys often indicate that Joe Biden is trailing behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically are either leading or within the margin of error. This market will settle as YES if the vote percentage for Donald Trump in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the answer will be NO. The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: If Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race until July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If Biden drops out before this time, the question will resolve as "No".

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Biden remains in the race without withdrawing before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be accepted for resolution. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry resolves negatively.

(b) Biden does not withdraw and is capable of continuing his campaign until July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If Biden withdraws before this deadline, the inquiry will resolve as "No".

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed from the primary ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question regarding Trump will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question about Trump does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, or that any U.S. state will disqualify Donald Trump from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Joe Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race prior to July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable news reports. Speculative claims, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution. The matter concerning Trump will be resolved as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: The question regarding Trump does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Inflection will release a report detailing the findings from an independent red-team evaluation of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this question will be considered **YES** if they make available a *public* report by June 30, 2024, which includes the outcomes from a safety red-team assessment conducted by an *external* entity on one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if both of the following conditions are met by June 30, 2024:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

(b) Inflection does not publish a *public* report with results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The question resolves as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) is not met by the specified date.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be accessible to the general public in the European Union, and (b) Inflection will refrain from releasing a report that presents findings from external safety assessments of their models?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **YES** if both of the following criteria are satisfied by June 30, 2024:

(a) On June 30, 2024, [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations, or to particular demographics (e.g., minors), it will still be considered positive, provided that over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it will be viewed positively if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the name or website undergoes alterations.

(b) Inflection does not issue a *public* report detailing the outcomes from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

The inquiry will be regarded as **NO** if either condition (a) or condition (b) fails to be met by the designated date.

question.title: Will either Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if at least one of the following occurs by the specified dates:

(a) Inflection publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves positively even if unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain demographics, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains substantially the same even if rebranded.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will Inflection release a report detailing the findings from external evaluations of their models regarding safety, or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with **YES** if at least one of the following happens by the stated deadlines:

(a) Inflection issues a *publicly accessible* report containing the findings from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is to have access without needing a VPN, potentially involving a fee. It counts as a positive outcome even if it is not available in specific EU nations or to certain groups, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it. The term "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it is considered a positive outcome if the service remains largely unchanged, even if it undergoes rebranding.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an officially recognized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if a referendum takes place in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum occurs before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legal binding authority.

A referendum will not be regarded as resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum held does not have the consent of the London government. It will not resolve as Yes if a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style of referendum is held without UK government permission, or if a vote is organised by civil society institutions without official sanction.

para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the market referenced in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) achieves 377 participants before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no official referendum conducted in Scotland concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, or if any referendum that occurs lacks the approval of the London government. It will not resolve as Yes if a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum is executed without UK government consent, or if a vote is organized by civil society entities without official endorsement.

question.body:
(a) Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024? Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.body:
(a) Is Scotland going to conduct an official, authorized referendum regarding its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This will be resolved as **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence is held, provided that it takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" one; it does not need to have any legally binding implications. A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be acknowledged to have the approval of the London government.
