question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** with respect to this condition if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. **Joe Biden's Announcement**: Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

   To qualify for a **Yes** resolution with respect to this condition, the absence of such a statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: there should be no room for the possibility that Biden has announced he would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as **No**.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if both conditions are satisfied as described above. If either condition resolves as **No**, the overall question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will happen: (a) Russia will take control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will not publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. **Russia's Control of Chasiv Yar**: When reviewed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of these categories:
   - Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
   - Evaluated Russian Gains in the Recent 24 Hours
   - Evaluated Russian Authority
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories introduced by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area.

   The question will resolve as **No** concerning this criterion if the area is not classified under any of the categories that denote Russian authority, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Advances in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

2. **Joe Biden's Declaration**: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign must not issue a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   To qualify for a **Yes** resolution regarding this condition, the absence of such a statement must be clear and definitive: there must be no ambiguity that Biden has announced he would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

   If such a definitive statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as **No**.

The overall question will resolve as **Yes** only if both conditions are met as outlined above. If either condition resolves as **No**, the overall question will resolve as **No**.

question.body:

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

(b) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, at the time of review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional categories created by ISW that signify Russian control of the area
The question will be resolved as **No** if the location is not classified under any of the categories that suggest Russian control, including but not limited to:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In all other scenarios, the question will conclude as **No**.

If either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a trustworthy news organization report on it a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) If Joe Biden drops out, no reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will be considered **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in the spotlight; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on election day in 2024; it is exclusively determined by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This question will be resolved as YES if no major and trustworthy media organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially declares his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) A reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. This will resolve as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following situations will happen: (a) A trustworthy news organization reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours ahead of time, or (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This will be marked as N/A if Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is nominated on the election day.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above and (2) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be less than or equal to that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
(1) This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context:

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Old" - C+

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

para_P.body:
(1) This market will conclude with a YES if "Trap" (2024) earns a B CinemaScore or better, and it will conclude with a NO if it scores a B- or lower. If a CinemaScore is not available for any reason, it will be marked as N/A.

Context:

(2) This question will be marked as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported on Boxofficemojo at the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is less than or equal to $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will either "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, or will "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391, the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013). The box office opening is verified by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1). (b) "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher. para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) The domestic box office debut for **Deadpool & Wolverine** surpasses $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013). The box office debut is confirmed by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1). (b) "Trap" (2024) achieves a B CinemaScore or better. The market will resolve to NO if neither of these scenarios occurs. If "Trap" does not have an available CinemaScore, this part of the question will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This inquiry is not limited to those candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who ends up receiving the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (b) Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution will be based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast website. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.
(b) Francis Suarez will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will resolve as Yes if any other candidate is selected. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024; (b) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will indicate that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on their election predictions for July 19, 2024. The outcome will rely on the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this will result in a 50-50 outcome. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding figures to July 19 will be utilized.
(b) Francis Suarez will not be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The question will be answered Yes if any other candidate is chosen. This is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For part (a), the resolution is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). This is not restricted to candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not affect the resolution. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this part will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump.

For part (a), the outcome is based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). This is not limited to currently discussed candidates; additional options may emerge later.

For part (b), the resolution will depend on FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, particularly the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methods will not impact the resolution. If Biden and Trump have the same probability, this part will resolve as 50-50. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

(b) Resolves YES if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus, and once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Taylor Swift makes an appearance in the film Deadpool and Wolverine (b) The opening weekend domestic box office for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Taylor Swift is seen in the movie "Deadpool & Wolverine" in any capacity, including if her voice is used for a character. It will also count as YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is confirmed by reliable independent sources.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the opening domestic box office for "Deadpool & Wolverine" as reported by Boxofficemojo is greater than $185,548,391, which is the total of the opening box office for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This question will have the same resolution as the original on Metaculus, and once the original is resolved, this market will automatically reflect that resolution.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Serbia qualify and Malta fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; and (b) Malta does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning they either do not participate in a Semi-final or are not announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If either Serbia does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Serbia make it to the Grand Final while Malta does not for Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Serbia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final; and (b) Malta fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, which means they either do not compete in a Semi-final or are not acknowledged by the EBU as having advanced to the Grand Final. If either Serbia does not advance or Malta does, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Serbia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Malta or Serbia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will yield a **Yes** response if one of the following takes place: (a) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Serbia competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the inquiry will yield a **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if, as of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's, based on the Companies Market Cap data, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is not larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump is disqualified or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Nvidia's market valuation is not greater than that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prohibited from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prohibited from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is not higher than that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

The question will be answered with "No" if either or both of these conditions fail to be met.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-July 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's on July 17, 2024, or (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to Yes if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question resolves to No if neither of these conditions are met by their respective dates.

para_P.title: By mid-July 2024, will any of the following happen: (1) Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple on July 17, 2024, or (2) Donald Trump is either removed from or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is considered a Yes if at least one of these conditions is fulfilled:

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market value is higher than Apple's, as per Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The question is a No if neither of these conditions is satisfied by the specified dates.

question.title: Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (78 more!)

Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the linked market to have a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15? (An increase of 78!)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) ISS advises voting against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, and (b) the linked market gets fewer than 377 traders by July 15?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has fewer than 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) ISS recommends opposing Elon Musk's compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's reappointment, and (b) the referenced market has less than 377 participants by July 15?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly urging Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package during the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR to reject Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. If not, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

(b) It will resolve as YES if the aforementioned market has fewer than 377 participants before it closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO otherwise.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: (a) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve NO otherwise. (b) The question will resolve YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) The associated market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15 (b) ISS recommends that Tesla stockholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: (a) The associated market will be deemed YES if it has 377 traders prior to market closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be considered NO otherwise. (b) The inquiry will be deemed YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla stockholders to vote against Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of Tesla. If not, the inquiry will be considered NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump's polling and Biden's polling exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved by examining Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be treated as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be greater Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (b) Trump's margin over Biden will either be 2 or less, or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) The resolution of this question will depend on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must surpass the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

(b) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: By their respective deadlines, will either of the following happen: (a) Will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the value recorded for that date shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would represent a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This inquiry will be determined based on data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024, must be higher than the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Will Team USA secure gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered affirmatively if both the men's and women's teams from the United States achieve gold medals. It will be answered negatively if either team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States fails to win gold in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the United States men's or women's basketball team places anywhere other than gold at the Paris Olympics. 

It resolves **No** if either the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals (b) The United States does not secure a gold medal in either Men's or Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with **Yes** if both of these conditions are satisfied: (1) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as confirmed by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) Either the United States men's or women's basketball team finishes in a position other than first place at the Paris Olympics. 

The answer is **No** if the Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the United States takes home gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if neither condition is satisfied.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Team USA secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) The Philadelphia 76ers claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Team USA achieves gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball competitions at the Paris Olympics. (b) The Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be resolved as **No** if neither scenario takes place.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024, and (b) the Democrats avoid a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Reference link: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to step down at any time before midnight Central Time on July 20, this condition will be considered true. If not, it will be deemed false.

(b) This condition will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party can nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election without needing more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot. If it takes more than one ballot, then this condition will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024: This is determined as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this is determined as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step aside prior to July 20: This is determined as **Yes** if at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times reports 10 or more Democratic Senators urging Biden to step aside. Otherwise, it is determined as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of fulfilling the powers and responsibilities of his office" and subsequently appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of any incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count towards the second condition.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday and remain unrecognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This resolves to YES if both of the following take place: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) do not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of any incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count towards the second condition. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count towards the second condition.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? (b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden die before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following will take place: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024? (b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacitation is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(b) Joe Biden passes away before July 26th, 2024: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the total count of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds that number.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 and fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (a) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) fewer than 24 world records are broken during the Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

For condition (a), the medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

For condition (b), the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics must be fewer than 24.

para_P.title: Will France achieve a Top 5 finish while fewer than 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are counted as positive) at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) less than 24 world records are established throughout the Paris Olympics. The inquiry will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

For criterion (a), the medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

For criterion (b), the total world records established during the Paris Olympics must be fewer than 24.

question.title: Will either at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics or France place in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 24 world records be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics, or will France secure a position in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) At least 24 world records are established during the Paris Olympics. (b) France achieves a Top 5 finish (ties are counted positively) at the 2024 Olympics. If the Olympics do not occur in 2024, the resolution will be uncertain. The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each participating nation and sorting them by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (In case of a tie for first) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for second) Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement expected to receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true:

1. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement does not receive approval at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. OpenAI publicly affirms its commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement made by the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman, before July 1, 2024. This statement can take the form of either a formal announcement (like a press release) or an informal remark (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The declaration from OpenAI must reflect a heightened commitment to the stated principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot merely restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism." Metaculus will confirm that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus might contact select signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of approval regarding OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as robust as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

2. At the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement does not get approved in a voting process, based on reports from reliable sources.

question.title: Will either the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly or will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (2) Before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true regarding OpenAI's commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle: - OpenAI publicly commits to the principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement must indicate a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published. - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step".

para_P.title: Is there a chance that the Pandemic Agreement will receive approval during the May 2024 World Health Assembly, or that OpenAI will make a public pledge to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (1) The Pandemic Agreement is voted on and approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by reliable sources. (2) Before July 1, 2024, both of these conditions are met regarding OpenAI's pledge to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle: - OpenAI makes a public commitment to this principle through a statement from the company or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (like a tweet or a quote in an interview). It must express a new level of commitment compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was released. - Metaculus confirms that the company has accepted this principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements that are at least as strong as "this was a good first step".

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify and Malta fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus does not qualify or Malta qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Cyprus to advance while Malta does not in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Cyprus fails to advance or Malta does advance, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Malta or Cyprus secure a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the nomination from the Democratic Party for the presidency?

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, AND will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). (2) No definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, there must be no unambiguous and conclusive statement that leaves no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the US government will terminate its agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, AND that Joe Biden will refrain from announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following take place: (1) The US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially cancels or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) prior to August 3, 2024. (2) There is no clear, public, official declaration made by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election. For a Yes resolution, there must be no clear and definitive statement that eliminates any possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If both criteria are satisfied, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. 

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Will either of the following take place prior to their set deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The US government terminates its contract with Verisign for overseeing the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive. 

(b) Will the US government conclude its agreement that permits Verisign to manage the official domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This will be considered Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially cancels or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. [Market link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(2) This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, and the question resolves YES if the lead is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.
