para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) The associated market will have no fewer than 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden will be either 2 or less, or more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) The associated market will be classified as YES if it has at least 377 traders prior to the market's closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be classified as NO otherwise. [Market link](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)

(2) This inquiry will be resolved according to Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as recorded on July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, and the question will resolve as YES if the lead is 2 or less, or exceeds 4. For instance, a figure of 2.4 indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 15, 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average, or (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2024, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: By July 15, 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 and at most 4 based on 538's national polling average, or (b) the specified market has a minimum of 377 participants?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with YES if Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 4 points in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has no fewer than 377 participants prior to the market's closure on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. It will resolve to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) close sub $100 per share by 7/31?
question.body: This market resolves to YES if NVDA closes below 100$ on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) to finish below $100 per share by July 31?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if NVDA ends any day before July 31 at a price lower than $100.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) never closes below $100 per share before 7/31?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) This market resolves to YES if NVDA does not close below $100 on any day before 7/31.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Core CPI in the US rises by over 0.1% from June to July 2024 (b) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) maintains a closing price above $100 per share at all times before July 31?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution will be based on data sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) This market will be considered YES if NVDA does not record a closing price below $100 on any day prior to July 31.

question.title: Will either Nvidia close sub $100 per share by 7/31 or US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 on any day before 7/31, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nvidia to finish below $100 per share by July 31, or for the US Core CPI to rise over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if either: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) has a closing price under $100 on any day prior to July 31, or (b) the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to June 2024, utilizing the precise (not rounded) figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Norway competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Should Norway fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify and Norway fail to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland does not qualify or Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Switzerland to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 while Norway does not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Norway fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Switzerland does not advance or Norway successfully qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Norway or Switzerland will make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Norway takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Norway nor Switzerland secures qualification, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Authority

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control over the area



The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the area is not categorized under any of the classifications that show Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **Donald Trump Removal or Blockage:**
   - On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or blockage must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. **Russian Control of Chasiv Yar:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as "No" if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Russia not maintain authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the subsequent conditions are satisfied:

1. **Trump's Exclusion from the Ballot:**
   - As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being excluded from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. **Status of Chasiv Yar under Russian Control:**
   - On June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map must indicate that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E do not fall under any of the following classifications: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories established by ISW that signify Russian oversight of the area. The question will be answered with "No" if the area is categorized under any of the classifications that indicate Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other classifications created by ISW that denote Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not satisfied.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither of these conditions is met by their respective dates.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Russia will gain control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, or that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any categories that signify Russian control, such as:
- Evaluated Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Evaluated Russian Control
- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories established by ISW that denote Russian control of the area

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources.

The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if neither of these scenarios occurs by their specified dates.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value indicated Trump was 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would represent a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden will be ≤2 or >3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(2) Resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) A Trump family member becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden will be ≤2 or >3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Resolves **Yes** if any of the following individuals secures the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(2) Resolves **Yes** if the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election shows that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(b) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 3 based on 538's national polling average? (b) A Trump family member becomes the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election that is greater than 2 and no more than 3. This will be determined by the figure shown on the graph for that date, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies a lead for Biden.

(b) A member of the Trump family is chosen as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024. This encompasses Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) expected to increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data published by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is the same or lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(2) This resolves as **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed for July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (2) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index on July 20, 2024, is equal to or lower than the value from a year prior?
para_P.body:
(1) This will be considered **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

(2) This will be considered **Yes** if the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is less than or equal to the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the reported number by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS) for July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.
(b) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. The question considers all candidates, including any new candidates added in the future.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will reflect a Year-over-Year rise on July 20, 2024, if the data reported by the St. Louis Fed (https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS) on that date exceeds the figure from July 20, 2023.
(b) Donald Trump will become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This selection is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the nominee on election day. The inquiry takes into account all candidates, including any new entrants that may emerge later.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following be true: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
1. There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

2. This question will resolve as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Are both of these statements true: (1) When compared to a generic Democrat, Trump receives a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, and (2) Donald Trump Jr. does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
1. Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for a vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll when both polls conclude. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

2. This question will be answered YES if Donald Trump Jr. is not chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will lead to a NO resolution. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later. The outcome is determined solely by the selections made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other with a generic Democrat. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Donald Trump Jr. will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Trump will achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Donald Trump Jr. set to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently under consideration; additional options may emerge in the future. The outcome is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) When up against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump secure at least a 3% advantage among Manifold respondents? There are two Manifold polls available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks participants to choose between Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other includes a generic Democrat. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the close of both polls. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official declaration regarding Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will not die before the end of Friday, July 26th?
question.body:
(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.
(b) There will be no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) Kimberly Cheatle will cease to be the Director of the U.S. Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will remain alive until after the market closes on Friday, July 26th?
para_P.body:
(a) Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will either resign, be dismissed, or otherwise not hold the position of director of the Secret Service before the date of October 12, 2024.
(b) There will not be any formal communication regarding the death of Joe Biden before the market closure at the end of Friday, July 26th.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden die before Saturday or the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: This resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday or that the head of the Secret Service will step down within the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: This will be considered a YES if one of the following takes place: (a) An official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, who is the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any other reason ceases to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If neither occurs, it will be a NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. Future candidates may also be considered beyond those currently listed.

The determination of this question is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), and not on who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Ted Cruz is selected, this will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, while Ted Cruz is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure suggests Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate apart from Ted Cruz is chosen, this will also resolve as **Yes**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other candidates may be included later. The outcome is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and is not influenced by who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Ted Cruz is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is decided by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceeds 3 but does not surpass 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination for the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Trustworthy users are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if no definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a definitive statement is made before this time.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) a subsequent Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Joe Biden refraining from announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no clear, public, official announcement made by Joe Biden or his campaign before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not run for and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. Resolves NO if such a clear statement is issued before this deadline.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If no such statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves as No otherwise.

This question resolves as Yes if either (a) or (b) resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) another Democratic presidential debate takes place prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly and officially announces that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no indication that Biden would accept the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, this will be deemed No.

(b) Will there be an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party? This will be considered Yes if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be deemed No in other circumstances.

This question will be considered Yes if either (a) or (b) is determined to be Yes.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing the findings from an independent red-teaming evaluation of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered **YES** if they make a *public* report available by June 30, 2024, showcasing the outcomes from an *external* red-teaming assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety?
question.body:
(a) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is accessible to the public in the European Union, and (b) Google DeepMind refrains from releasing a report detailing results from external evaluations of their models regarding safety?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry concerning OpenAI's ChatGPT will be deemed **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is publicly accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Publicly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the populace can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Regarding Google DeepMind, this question will resolve as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not release a *public* report containing the results from an *external* organization evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this part resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this part resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it possible that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will happen: (a) a report detailing the results of external safety assessments on Google DeepMind's models is published, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this aspect will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *public* document with findings from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI systems.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this aspect will be marked as **YES** if ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Broadly accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without the need for a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or if it is restricted for (for example) minors, it will still be considered positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models, and it will still be marked positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).
