question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the figure recorded for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If no qualifying interview is released before the end of July, this condition is not met. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading. The value will be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both conditions must be satisfied for the overall question to resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (1) Joe Biden conduct an in-person interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Trump's advantage over Biden be either 2 or less, or exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in an in-person interview for no less than 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This interview must be filmed and can feature appearances on platforms such as podcasts, late-night shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person. Events like press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not qualify. If no acceptable interview is released before the end of July, this condition is not fulfilled. 

(2) Trump's lead over Biden must be either 2 or fewer, or more than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. The figure will be verified on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

Both criteria must be met for the overall question to be answered with YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 according to 538's national polling average? (b) Before the end of July 2024, Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview took place when Biden appeared on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage showing Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might feature only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not qualifying.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Orlando Magic going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are awarded the title of champions in the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** for any other teams as they will not be in the running.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if either the New York Knicks do not win the Finals or the Orlando Magic win the Finals.

para_P.title: Will the New York Knicks emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals while the Orlando Magic do not?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/): (a) The New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) The Orlando Magic are not declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It will be answered with **No** if either the New York Knicks fail to win the Finals or the Orlando Magic succeed in winning the Finals.

question.title: Will either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins and they are both eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks to take home the championship in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if both teams do not win and are eliminated from the playoffs.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
(1) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events will take place: (1) A terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics (2) The ICC refrains from issuing arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if this does not occur.

An event will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is categorized as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The question will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue an [arrest warrant](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the following Israeli cabinet officials before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials by July 1, 2024, (b) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) releases a warrant for the arrest of any of these Israeli government figures: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will be answered with **No** otherwise.

(b) The inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in Metropolitan France results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be answered with No if this does not occur. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any agency of the French State, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump is leading, while a negative figure implies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For condition (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For condition (b), a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden. The question will resolve as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's advantage over Biden be 3 points or less, or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is 3 points or less or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. 

For criterion (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on election day in 2024; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For criterion (b), a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, a figure of 2.4 indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points. The inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Trump's lead is <= 3 or > 4 on the specified date.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 in 538's national polling average, or will Chris Christie be the GOP candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) exceeds 3 and is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. (b) Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur in Eurovision 2024: (a) Slovenia qualifies for the Grand Final, and (b) Malta fails to qualify for the Grand Final?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that in Eurovision 2024, both Slovenia will make it to the Grand Final and Malta will not?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the following two criteria are satisfied: (a) Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Malta either does not compete in a Semi-final or is not confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if neither country qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Francis Suarez to become the Republican nominee while Tucker Carlson does not secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

For the purposes of this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will conclude as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is met. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial and (b) Will Hurd does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: 

1. [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

2. Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any different candidate is chosen, this condition is fulfilled. This is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following takes place: (a) Will Hurd be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: 

(a) Hurd is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This nomination is determined by the choices made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) takes place.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden be projected as the favorite by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, and (b) Tim Scott not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this condition is not met. The resolution will occur as soon as the July 20 datapoints become available, or by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, using the nearest previous figures to July 19 if necessary.

(b) Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this condition is met. The resolution is based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (a) FiveThirtyEight will indicate Joe Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, and (b) Tim Scott will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is anticipated to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This is assessed based on the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for that date. If Biden and Trump are shown to have the same chances, this condition will not be satisfied. The outcome will be determined as soon as the datapoints from July 20 are released, or by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, using the closest previous data to July 19 if needed.

(b) Tim Scott is not chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. If any other candidate is chosen, this condition will be fulfilled. The resolution is solely based on the choice made by the Republican National Convention delegates, irrespective of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

Details for each component:

(a) Tim Scott being the nominee: This resolves as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the convention's selection.

(b) Biden being the favorite: This resolves as **Yes** if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not affect the resolution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that 538 indicates Biden as the leading contender this Friday?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024.

Details for each aspect:

(a) Tim Scott being the candidate: This will be affirmed as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the decision is determined solely by the convention's choice.

(b) Biden being the leading contender: This will be confirmed as **Yes** if Joe Biden is forecasted to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve at 50-50. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not influence the resolution.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This inquiry will be considered a Yes if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following four occurrences take place, based on official announcements or reliable news:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat who represents the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats who is stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat who represents the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats who is stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports by that date, the resolution will be No.

Additional details and fine print can be accessed on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically be applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. For early resolution requests or to report issues, feel free to contact @jskf.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China between June 1, 2024, and August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if between June 1, 2024, and August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports during this period, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China from June 1, 2024, to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, during the timeframe from June 1, 2024, to August 1, 2024, any of the following four occurrences take place, based on official announcements or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels a diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls one of its diplomats who is stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels a diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls one of its diplomats who is stationed in the Philippines. 

If none of these events are reported during this period, then the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body: Will either of the following occur before their respective dates according to official statements or credible reports: (a) Before August 1, 2024: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. (b) Before June 1, 2024: The same diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China as described. If any of these events occur before their respective dates, the question resolves as Yes; otherwise, it resolves as No.

para_P.title: Will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to August 1, 2024?
para_P.body: Is it possible that any of the following actions take place before their specified deadlines according to official announcements or reliable sources: (a) Before August 1, 2024: The Philippines dismisses at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC), withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the PRC, the PRC dismisses at least one diplomat from the Philippines, or the PRC withdraws at least one of its diplomats from the Philippines. (b) Before June 1, 2024: Similar diplomatic dismissals or withdrawals occur between the Philippines and China as outlined. If any of these actions happen before their respective deadlines, the answer will be Yes; if not, it will be No.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

This question will be resolved based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: (a) GUE/NGL holds the most seats, and (b) Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) GUE/NGL holds the most seats, and (b) Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats. It will resolve as **No** if either GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats or Greens–EFA holds the most seats.

For GUE/NGL, the resolution is based on whether they hold the most seats, with ties resulting in a **Yes** outcome.

For Greens–EFA, the resolution is based on whether they do not hold the most seats, with ties resulting in a **No** outcome.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: After the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will both these events take place: (a) GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats, and (b) Greens–EFA fails to secure the highest number of seats?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats, and (b) Greens–EFA fails to secure the highest number of seats. It will be deemed **No** if either GUE/NGL does not secure the highest number of seats or if Greens–EFA secures the highest number of seats.

For GUE/NGL, the determination is based on whether they secure the highest number of seats, with any ties leading to a **Yes** outcome.

For Greens–EFA, the determination is based on whether they do not secure the highest number of seats, with any ties leading to a **No** outcome.

This question will be resolved based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will either the Greens–EFA or the GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either the Greens–EFA political group or the GUE/NGL political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA or GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the Greens–EFA political faction or the GUE/NGL political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, both associated inquiries will also resolve as **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any tennis player achieves a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Olympics: (a) No nation wins more than one women's team sport (b) No athlete wins more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

(a) Women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means no single NOC wins more than one of these events.

(b) No athlete wins more than one medal for tennis.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will it be the case that at the 2024 Olympics, (a) no country secures more than one gold medal in women's team sports and (b) no player achieves more than one medal in tennis?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

(a) Women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold in the following eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This indicates that no single NOC wins more than one of these competitions.

(b) No player is awarded more than one medal for tennis.

If both criteria are fulfilled, the resolution will be **Yes**. If either criterion is not fulfilled, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
- association football
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

The question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following scenarios to take place at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A tennis player secures more than one medal, (b) A single country achieves victory in more than one women's team event?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Any tennis player earns a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in two or more of the following women's team events at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
- soccer
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

The answer will be **No** if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold medals in these eight team events.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will exit the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the outcome will be a no.

question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing in the race before the deadline of July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

2. Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 and be at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson not be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 3 and at most 4 on the graph for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead.

2. Tucker Carlson is not nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if either of the following happens: (1) Tucker Carlson is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is determined solely by the choice of the Republican National Convention delegates, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceeds 3 and is at most 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's lead over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this sub-question will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) the Greens–EFA group secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is ≤ 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be answered with **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for the highest number of seats, this sub-question will be answered with **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. (b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538? Additionally, will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as shown in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, if the report on July 5, 2024, indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points, this would count as a positive 2.4 for this question.

(b) This question will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the case of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.
