(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. Future candidates that may emerge will also be taken into account. The nominee is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and not by who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the BSE SENSEX closing value on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule (b) The Democrats will not experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule: Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating an initiative to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, presents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite troubled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to suppress debate and I suppose by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a cumulative total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

(b) The Democrats will not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only a single round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is necessary, then this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient for this to occur. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly express their opposition to the plan for Biden's early virtual nomination?
para_P.body:
(a) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This happens if the Democratic Party needs to conduct more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this does not happen.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly express their opposition to the early nomination plan for Biden: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters that together have a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice for this to happen. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this does not occur.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

para_P.title: Is Albania set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Albania competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The outcome will be **No** for any other scenarios concerning Albania.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Albania fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Albania either does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to happen: (a) Iceland makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 and (b) Albania does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Iceland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Albania either does not take part in a Semi-final or is not officially recognized by the EBU as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either criterion is not satisfied, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will either Albania or Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Albania or Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** if neither country qualifies.

para_P.title: Are Albania or Iceland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of Albania or Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, it will resolve as **No** if both nations do not qualify.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, midnight ET, and (b) Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Proxy force attacks do not count.

(b) This part will resolve to "Yes" if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, neither in person nor remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Iran will commence a military operation on Israeli land prior to midnight ET on August 13, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will not give testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment will be considered "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military operation" refers to any forceful action taken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by reliable reporting. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions, but excludes cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic efforts. Only actions that are explicitly claimed by Iran or verified to have originated from Iranian territory will be counted. Attacks by proxy forces are not included.

(b) This segment will be deemed "Yes" if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has not provided testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will give testimony at the hush money trial or that Iran will launch a military response prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or through a remote connection, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran commences a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. For this market, a "military operation" will be defined as any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this market will conclude with a "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, economic sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be included in the resolution of this market. Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democrats experience a contested convention in 2024, and will Trump's margin over Biden be either 2 or less, or exceed 4 as of July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) The Democratic Party must go through multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this requirement is not fulfilled. (2) The lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) must be either 2 or less, or greater than 4, as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. If both criteria are met, this question will resolve as **Yes**; otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following situations will happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will conclude with Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure shows Biden in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which counts as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question. (b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the BSE SENSEX's closing figure on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but not surpass 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry determines the BSE SENSEX's closing figure on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is ≤ 75k or > 77k?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is independent of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be checked according to Yahoo Finance. The question resolves as Yes if it is less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 77,000.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump secures the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) On July 21, 2024, the final value of BSE SENSEX is either ≤ 75k or > 77k?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump will obtain the Republican nomination if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not influenced by who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly determined by the choice of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

(b) The final value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be verified through Yahoo Finance. The answer will be Yes if it is less than or equal to 75,000 or exceeds 77,000.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will either of the following take place: (a) The closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75k but not surpass 77k, or (b) Donald Trump be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) This question will be considered **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance, is more than 75,000 and at most 77,000. (b) This question will be considered **Yes** if Donald Trump is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge later. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (2) Francis Suarez not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? 
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html
If at any point before midnight July 20, 2024, Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

This part will resolve as Yes if Francis Suarez is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this part will resolve as Yes. This is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) at least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to resign prior to July 20, 2024, and (2) Francis Suarez will not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) Will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20, 2024? 
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html
If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators who call for Biden to step down at any point before midnight July 20, 2024, Central Time, this part will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(2) Will Francis Suarez not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
This part will resolve as Yes if Francis Suarez is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, this part will resolve as Yes. This is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge in the future.
For this part, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 
(a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. 
(b) At any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as indicated by the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If this condition is met, the question will resolve as **Yes**; otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following takes place: 
(a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This conclusion is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. 
(b) At any time prior to midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators demand that Biden step aside, as noted by the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If this condition is satisfied, the inquiry will conclude with a **Yes**; if not, it will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of securing the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a "No" if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. If both candidates are viewed as equally likely to win, this market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the day of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight employs to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. The resolution may be delayed until the data for July 20 is available. If the July 19 data is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (2) 538 Project Biden as not the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. 

(2) This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (1) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 according to 538's national polling average? (2) Will 538 indicate that Biden is not the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. 

(2) This market will be marked as “Yes” if Donald Trump is deemed more likely to win the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will be marked as “No” if Joe Biden is more likely to win than Donald Trump based on the same forecast for that date. If both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's calculation methods will not affect the outcome of this market.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden is projected as the favorite by 538 on July 19, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Biden is projected as the favorite by 538 on July 19, 2024: This will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this date. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect resolution. Resolution will occur according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purpose.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) on July 19, 2024, 538 ranks Biden as the frontrunner, or (b) on July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden falls within the range of 2 to 4 points according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) On July 19, 2024, if FiveThirtyEight's election forecast shows that Joe Biden has a greater likelihood of winning the presidential election compared to Donald Trump, this will be considered a “Yes”. Conversely, it will be a “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden based on the same forecast for that day. In the event that both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. The resolution will derive from the FiveThirtyEight presidential election forecast for 2024, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not impact the resolution. The resolution will take place based on the data points for July 19 as soon as those for July 20 are accessible. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding figures to July 19 will be utilized. The resolution pertains to the winning odds of both candidates expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place. The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

(b) Trump's margin over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average: This will be determined by Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as illustrated on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates that Trump is leading, while a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, if Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, this would be recorded as a positive value of 2.4 for this assessment.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to the possibility of other candidates being included later on.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only based on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, it resolves as No.

(b) Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it resolves as Yes. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Will Hurd does not become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not run for or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be straightforward and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, it will be considered No.

(b) Will Will Hurd not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be considered Yes if Will Hurd is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is selected, it will also be considered Yes. The resolution depends on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is nominated on election day.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (1) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the votes of the delegates at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election. (2) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If neither of these situations occurs, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Meta will release a report detailing the outcomes of an external assessment of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, Meta makes available a *public* report that includes the findings from an *external* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, and (b) Meta does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) The market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, 2023). Resolves NO otherwise. (b) This question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta does not publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.body: (a) The market located at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g will resolve to YES if it achieves 377 participants prior to the market's closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, 2023). It will resolve to NO otherwise. question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, or (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) by June 30, 2024, Meta releases a report detailing the findings from an external safety assessment of their models, or (b) the specified market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question is answered with **YES** if Meta issues a *publicly available* report by June 30, 2024, showing the results of an *independent* red-team evaluation concerning the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) It resolves to YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has reached 377 traders prior to the market's closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Elon Musk does not show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves as "Yes". If either condition is not met, the question resolves as "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following situations will happen: (1) Donald Trump is excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Elon Musk does not appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the next conditions are fulfilled:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the defined grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not excluded or barred from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

2. Elon Musk does not participate as a guest on the official platform of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, occurring from July 25-27, 2024.

If both conditions are satisfied, the inquiry resolves as "Yes". If either condition is not satisfied, the inquiry resolves as "No".

question.title: Will either Elon Musk appear at Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump be removed from any state's primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question resolves NO if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Elon Musk will take part in Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump will be excluded from any state's primary ballot as stipulated by Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Elon Musk is featured as a speaker on the main stage of Bitcoin Nashville 2024, a prominent Bitcoin conference scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This disqualification or barring must be validated through formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may arise after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

The inquiry will resolve with a NO if neither (a) nor (b) takes place.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are currently available, both of which conclude on July 6. One of these polls requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other solicits votes for a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in this hypothetical scenario either lead or are within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the general population?

This market will be deemed YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more upon the closing of both polls.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (2) Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(1) Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out, and two of the most endangered Democrats have written off Biden’s chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, multiple drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same group message, such as signing a letter or collectively asking him to drop out. Reports of unnamed Democrats are insufficient unless at least 5 names are made public. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(2) Two Manifold polls posted, closing on July 6, ask respondents to vote with Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 is less than or equal to that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events take place: (1) A minimum of five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th, and (2) Trump receives under 3% among Manifold participants when pitted against Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(1) According to Politico, two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race, and two of the most vulnerable Democrats have dismissed Biden’s chances for victory in November. Privately, several drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one urging Biden to terminate his campaign. This market will resolve to YES if at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The individuals must be part of the same collective communication, such as endorsing a letter or jointly asking him to step down. Reports of unnamed Democrats will not suffice unless at least five names are disclosed. If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, the market will resolve to NO.

(2) Two Manifold surveys conducted, concluding on July 6, solicit participants to choose between Joe Biden and a generic Democrat on a theoretical ballot. This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll is less than or equal to that in the second poll by a margin of less than 3% when both polls are finalized. The calculation for determining Trump’s vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the query) + Someone else)). The outcome will be YES if the difference in these calculations from poll 1 to poll 2 is less than 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

question.title: Will either Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? 
- There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.
- This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.
- The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
- This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- The market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Trump will increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, or that a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) When positioned against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, could Trump boost his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants? 
- Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll solicits Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.
- This market will yield a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater upon the closing of both polls.
- The calculation for determining the vote percentage for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

(2) Will a coalition of at least 5 specified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th? 
- This market resolves to YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collectively ask Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be executed through signing a letter or another method such as a group engaging with Biden directly and collectively urging him to step aside.
- The market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step down will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public prior to the market's closing date. In unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Keep Its Majority in the EU from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus retaining the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) Fidesz-KDNP fails to maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU, and (b) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, credible sources report that the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby failing to maintain the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) Credible sources announce that the European Union (EU) has put forth new tariffs or duties affecting the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024, and (b) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, credible sources indicate that the Fidesz-KDNP alliance fails to achieve more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus not preserving the largest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament.

(b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will take place: (a) Fidesz-KDNP retains its status as the largest Hungarian party in the EU in 2024, or (b) the EU declares new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following happens: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition gains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, based on reliable information. (b) Before July 5, 2024, trustworthy sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has revealed plans to impose new tariffs or duties on the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Disney regarding a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?

It will also be marked NO if a Moana attraction is announced for a different theme park in Florida or any other location. question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? (2) Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:
(1) Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

(2) This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (1) Will the opening weekend for Deadpool & Wolverine set a record as the highest ever for an R-rated film? (2) Will Disney refrain from revealing a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Experts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film. Directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, the movie is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its debut weekend. This would establish a new record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the U.S., the film is projected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the largest R-rated opening in history. The current record for the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine surpasses $284.5M globally this opening weekend as reported AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a comparable source) acknowledges it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

(2) This will resolve YES if Disney does not unveil a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if Disney announces a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will also resolve NO if it is mentioned in a brainstorming context similar to how some attractions were discussed at the last D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for another theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention. The resolution will occur after the convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. This will resolve YES if such an announcement is made and NO if it is merely discussed as a potential idea or if a Moana ride is announced for a different park. Betting closes on August 8, 2024, and resolution will occur after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter or an equivalent publication as the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The film must surpass the previous record set by the original Deadpool, which was $284.5 million globally.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Disney will unveil a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024, or (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
(a) Disney unveils a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. This will be marked as YES if such an unveiling occurs and NO if it is only mentioned as a potential concept or if a Moana attraction is introduced in a different park. Betting will close on August 8, 2024, and the outcome will be determined after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend and is reported by the Hollywood Reporter or a similar outlet as the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. The movie must exceed the previous record held by the original Deadpool, which was $284.5 million globally.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw from the race before July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to proceed with the campaign prior to midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

If either condition fails, this question will resolve as **No**.

If either of these criteria is not met, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of these events will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. This decision is made based on the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the nominee on election day.
