question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as illustrated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack linked to Israel occurring within Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is appointed by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the US. If any other individual is chosen, the outcome will be **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently recognized; additional candidates may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 election; the decision is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur: (a) credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. (b) Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Tucker Carlson being selected as the nominee will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district remain in Republican hands during the special election of 2024, and will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) trustworthy sources indicate that a candidate representing the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an official source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be void. (b) Tucker Carlson is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is chosen as the candidate, the answer will be No. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later. It is important to note that the identity of the Republican nominee on the date of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the Republican National Convention delegates.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will be marked as **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed, and others may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This inquiry will be marked as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, the question will be nullified.

question.title: Will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Indiana Pacers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers secure the title in the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be answered with **No** if any other team wins, as they will have been removed from the competition.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals and the Indiana Pacers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as Yes if both of the following occur: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Indiana Pacers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as No if either the Los Angeles Clippers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals or the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals.

para_P.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals while the Indiana Pacers will not be the champions?
para_P.body:
The answer is Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Los Angeles Clippers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (b) The Indiana Pacers do not become the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

The answer is No if either the Los Angeles Clippers fail to win the 2024 NBA Finals or if the Indiana Pacers succeed in winning the 2024 NBA Finals.

question.title: Will either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers to become champions in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
The outcome will be **Yes** if either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be **No** if neither of these teams secures the championship title.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in his position as president, and will Nikki Haley not be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States. (2) Nikki Haley is not nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; what matters is who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made based on the selection by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is awarded the Republican nomination on election day in 2024.

(b) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (b) Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this question resolves as **No**. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will both of the following happen: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (b) will the Greens–EFA not possess the majority of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (possibly requiring a payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or not available to specific demographics, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" pertains to the general online interface for engaging with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has been altered, as long as OpenAI's service remains largely unchanged.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction does not secure the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If there is a tie between two groups for the number of seats, this question will resolve as **No**. This determination will be based on official announcements by the European Parliament or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either (a) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this will resolve as **Yes**. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

For (b), the question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to minors, it will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) the Greens–EFA will secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either (a) the Greens–EFA political faction has the greatest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024. 

For (a), the resolution will be **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction possesses the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for all other scenarios. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two groups, this will also resolve as **Yes**. This will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

For (b), the resolution will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (which may require a payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or not accessible to minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it. The term "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) used to interact with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to enter queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to publicly oppose their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and I suppose through sheer force, create unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will be deemed YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators associated with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are several such statements totaling 20 lawmakers' endorsements, it would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are met by market close, this condition resolves YES; otherwise, it resolves NO.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) fewer than 20 Democratic House or Senate members will endorse a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A public letter against the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 members from the House or Senate who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. If these conditions are satisfied by market close, this will resolve as YES; if not, it will resolve as NO.

Both of these conditions need to be met for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either one is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if any tennis player achieves a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals and No Athlete Win More Than One Medal for Tennis at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". (2) No athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

para_P.title: Will Neutral Individual Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals While Ensuring No Tennis Player Secures More Than One Medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if the following two criteria are fulfilled: (1) Neutral Individual Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as confirmed by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources. Should it be established that Neutral Individual Athletes have obtained 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this criterion will be resolved immediately to "Yes". (2) No tennis player wins two or more medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If both criteria are met, the inquiry will resolve to "Yes"; if not, it will resolve to "No".

question.title: Will either an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics, or for Individual Neutral Athletes to achieve at least 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Any athlete is awarded a minimum of two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution for (b) will rely on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP (2) Trump's lead over Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will take place: (1) Kamala Harris will be chosen as the Democratic Vice President (2) Trump's advantage over Biden will be 2 or fewer points, or more than 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average by 538?
para_P.body:
(1) Kamala Harris will be chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP, this market will affirm a yes outcome. If another individual is appointed as VP, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial selection will not alter the resolution of this market. The market can confirm its resolution right after the selection.

(2) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is either 2 points or fewer, or exceeds 4 points. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the context of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average: This inquiry will determine if Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President: If Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve positively. If another individual is chosen as VP, this market will resolve negatively. Any changes to the VP position after the initial selection will not affect the resolution of this market. The resolution can occur immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Nikki Haley going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will conclude as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it is not pertinent who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 
(b) Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

If both conditions are met, this question resolves YES. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday, and will Nikki Haley not be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: 
(a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 
(b) Nikki Haley fails to be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

If both criteria are satisfied, this inquiry resolves YES. If either criterion is not satisfied, this inquiry resolves NO.

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If neither of these events occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Joe Biden passes away before Saturday?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined exclusively by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). (b) There is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the outcome of this inquiry will be **No**.

question.title: Will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible for Paris Saint-Germain to secure victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: The inquiry resolves to "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain emerges victorious in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). Any other result will be considered "No".

question.title: Will Bayern Munich win and Paris Saint-Germain not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: This question resolves "Yes" if both of the following occur: (a) Bayern Munich wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA, and (b) Paris Saint-Germain does not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Any other outcome resolves "No".

para_P.title: Are Bayern Munich champions while Paris Saint-Germain fails to secure the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Bayern Munich emerges victorious in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024, as per UEFA's records, and (b) Paris Saint-Germain does not achieve victory in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA. Any alternative result will lead to a "No".

question.title: Will either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). If any other team wins, the question resolves "No".

para_P.title: Will one of Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich emerge victorious in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: The inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich secures victory in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). If a different team claims the title, the answer will be "No".

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Biden is still serving as the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed FALSE if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a TRUE outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden ceases to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

1. Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this question.

If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden stops being President prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: 

1. Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who is the candidate on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Joe Biden resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being the US President before the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not qualify as stopping being President for this inquiry.

If both criteria are met, the inquiry resolves as **Yes**. If either or both criteria are not met, the inquiry resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through end of July 2024 or Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to serve as President until the end of July 2024, or will Ron DeSantis be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) Biden stays in office as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered with NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) will not lead to a YES answer. (The Acting President is constitutionally distinct from the President.) (b) Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve to **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to currently listed candidates; others may be introduced later. For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and will Trump's lead over Biden be either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 2. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin set to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and will Trump's advantage over Biden be either at most 3 or exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?

1. Glenn Youngkin is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is either at most 3 or exceeds 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart for that date, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies a Biden lead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. **Trump's Lead over Biden**: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. **Glenn Youngkin as Nominee**: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Glenn Youngkin becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the subsequent events takes place:

1. **Trump's Advantage over Biden**: The margin by which Donald Trump leads Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is more than 3 and no greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, as indicated on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

2. **Glenn Youngkin as Candidate**: Glenn Youngkin is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the choices made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
