This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: (a) Joe Biden will still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates Biden is leading.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024 and (b) on July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden will be either 2 or less, or more than 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) Joe Biden will still hold the position of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) On July 15, 2024, as per 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump’s lead over Joe Biden will be either 2 or lower, or exceed 4, according to the chart for that date when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure means Trump is leading, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the end of July 2024: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Joe Biden still be president?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be greater than 2 and not exceed 4, according to the national polling average from 538, or (b) Will Joe Biden remain in the position of president?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, this would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This market will affirmatively resolve if, at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will there be a 45-minute or longer in-person conversation or interview with Joe Biden on camera before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place in April on The Howard Stern Show, where Biden responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will resolve to YES if Biden participates in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, the market will resolve to NO. 

It is important to note that this market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it can include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For instance, a 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Joe Biden refrain from having an in-person interview or on-camera conversation lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) The latest qualifying interview was Biden's participation on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. If Biden engages in another such in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is released before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to qualify. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count. For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, or (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024 for this to resolve YES. The interview must be on camera, and can include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, but must have at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, or (b) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is 4 or less on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) For this to be considered TRUE, Joe Biden needs to participate in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes before July 2024 ends. The interview must be recorded on video and may include segments from podcasts, late-night television, or programs like 60 Minutes, but it should contain at least 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. Events such as press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls are excluded from this count.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538. This will be verified using the data from 538's national polling average chart for July 15, 2024, which Metaculus will review on July 17, 2024. A positive figure will indicate that Trump is in the lead.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the competitor who achieves the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal, and (b) A swimmer does not win the most gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), and (b) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Will there be both of these events at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 5 nations achieve their first gold medal, and (b) A swimmer does not secure the highest number of gold medals?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) 5 or more nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal during the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions), and (b) the competitor with the greatest tally of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics does not participate in swimming events.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: (a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these events will take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer achieves the highest number of gold medals (b) Five or more nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the competitor who earns the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming. (b) This will be marked as **Yes** if at least five nations win their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden earlier than planned?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating to publicly oppose their party's strategy to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, which they believe suppresses the vital ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker participating in the movement.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He didn’t confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the accelerated nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively contain 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also be enough to determine this market as YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by market closure, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) fewer than 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This takes place if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this does not take place.

(b) fewer than 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter against the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this does not occur.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This is a combination of two questions:

1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? 
   - Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.
   - A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.
   - “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.
   - This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

2. Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
   - This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if either of these events occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at least 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate will endorse a public statement against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule, or will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question encompasses two parts:

1. Is it true that at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will publicly support a letter opposing the early virtual nomination of Biden? 
   - As reported by Politico, numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their dissent against their party's intention to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially planned, claiming it suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a participating lawmaker.
   - A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still very concerned about Biden’s candidacy going forward.
   - “This is a very poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and perhaps force unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.
   - This will be considered YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also qualify this market for a YES resolution. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, the market will resolve to NO.

2. Will the Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024?
   - This will be marked as YES if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will resolve as NO.

The overall question will be marked as YES if either of these scenarios takes place.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will conclude as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, this question will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Are both of the following conditions met: (a) Nate Silver's model indicates an increase in Kamala's chances of winning over the coming week (b) Ted Cruz is not chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the probability of Harris winning in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This inquiry will be answered with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is chosen, the answer will also be **Yes**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed and may include additional options later.

The determination of this question does not depend on who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Kamala's chances of winning will rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made exclusively by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and is not based on who is nominated by the Republican party on the date of the 2024 US election. (b) The probability assigned to Harris by the Electoral College in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve to NO in all other cases. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the Olympic Games in 2024, will five or more nations secure their inaugural gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if five or more nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, as verified by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals AND fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". (b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, according to credible sources. If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

para_P.title: Will athletes competing under a neutral flag secure 15 or more gold medals while less than 5 nations achieve their first Olympic gold at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games: (a) Athletes competing under a neutral flag collectively achieve at least 15 gold medals, as per the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC data is not available. If it is confirmed that athletes under a neutral flag have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this criterion will resolve to "Yes". (b) Less than 5 nations secure their first Olympic gold medal, according to trustworthy sources. If both criteria are met, the answer will be "Yes"; otherwise, it will be "No".

question.title: Will either at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable.

para_P.title: Is it possible for at least 5 nations to secure their first gold medal or for Individual Neutral Athletes to achieve 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Five or more nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, as reported by reliable sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together obtain 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal count published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources if the IOC's reporting is not available.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the French Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) The French Prime Minister is a member of New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered as **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be answered as **No** for any other political factions. If there is a tie in the number of seats between two factions, both sub-questions will be answered as **Yes**. The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

(b) This question will be answered as Yes if the political party of the French Prime Minister is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to trustworthy sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, or (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The French Prime Minister is part of a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, or (b) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be answered as Yes if, on July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, the French Prime Minister's party is neither New Popular Front nor Together, based on reliable sources.

(b) The answer will be Yes if the ID political faction has the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be No for any other political factions. In the event of a tie between two factions for the number of seats, both parts of the question will be answered as Yes.

The resolution of this question will depend on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media reports.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Switzerland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (b) Switzerland fails to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Switzerland does not qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal does not qualify or Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will happen: (a) Portugal makes it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (b) Switzerland does not make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Switzerland does not advance to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal fails to qualify or Switzerland qualifies, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Switzerland or Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Switzerland or Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Switzerland nor Portugal qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either Switzerland or Portugal to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Switzerland or Portugal competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if neither Switzerland nor Portugal secures qualification, the answer will be **No**.
